name: Hassan Kamran Bashir
title: Managing Partner
bio: A distinguished Advocate of the Supreme Court of Pakistan, esteemed for his exceptional expertise in taxation, international law, and corporate affairs. With a Master of Laws (LL.M) degree from the prestigious Harvard Law School, where he was a World Bank scholar, Mr. Bashir brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to his practice. His training as a commissioned officer of 23rd Common Training Program and extensive background in tax law, garnered from over 13 years of service with the Federal Board of Revenue, enables him to provide expert counsel to clients on complex tax matters, international trade laws, and corporate legal issues.
fullBio: He is also an adjunct faculty member at esteemed educational institutions of Lahore where he teaches Public International Law and Taxation to graduate level students pursuing external degree programs affiliated with various European universities. As a visionary and researcher, he has assisted planning and development sector and other policy making institutions. In 2015 and 2016 he worked with the Food and Agriculture Organization team for drafting Federal and Provincial laws. He was also the World Bank's consultant regarding the Punjab Revenue Authority Tax Litigation book in 2016-2017, and a resource person for the 'Contract Enforcement' workshop for CAREC (a regional organization of 11 countries) held in Urumqi, China in July 2018. He serves as Deputy Convenor of the Federation of Pakistan Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FPCCI) Legal Affairs Committee.

name: Barrister M. Faridoon Kamran
title: Junior Partner
bio: Our Junior Partner, Barrister M. Faridoon Kamran, was called to the Bar at the Honourable Society of Lincoln’s Inn in 2022. He holds an LL.M. in Arbitration and brings expertise in project finance, banking and finance, and commercial advisory. He also represents clients before the High Courts, Lower Courts, and Tribunals, with several reported judgments to his credit.
fullBio: Barrister M. Faridoon Kamran was called to the Bar at the Honourable Society of Lincoln’s Inn in 2022 and holds an LL.M. in Arbitration. He advises on project finance, banking and finance, and commercial matters, and regularly appears before High Courts, Lower Courts, and Tribunals. He has secured several reported judgments in favor of clients.

name: CH. Muhammad Ali
title: Advocate Supreme Court
bio: Leads the firm's criminal and civil practice. With over 23 years of experience, he has developed expertise in handling complex cases before Trial Courts, Tribunals, High Courts, and the Supreme Court. A protégé of renowned lawyer Mr. Munir Bhatti, Mr. Ali's extensive experience is complemented by his academic background, holding a Master's degree in Political Science from Government College Lahore and LL.B from University Law College, Lahore.
fullBio: Mr. Ali and his team are dedicated to delivering exceptional client service, ensuring meticulous due diligence, and pursuing matters with professionalism and integrity. With an academic foundation from the University Law College, Lahore, he brings a practical, courtroom-oriented approach to both criminal and civil matters, and regularly represents clients in major trials and appellate hearings.

name: Nasrminallah Mian
title: Advocate High Court
bio: Started with the Public sector as an Inland Revenue Service (IRS) officer with the 23rd Common Training Program and now has a diverse and well-rounded experience portfolio of about 25 years that includes operational experience in the Federal Government, transnational ICT corporate and a leading international financial institution in various leading roles. He received his LL.B from SM Law College, Karachi University. He also has a Master's degree in Management from ANU, Australia and a Master's degree in Chemistry from Pakistan.
fullBio: Nasr began his career in the public sector as an Inland Revenue Service (IRS) officer under the 23rd Common Training Program, and he brings about 25 years of combined operational and regulatory experience. His background spans assignments with the Federal Government, transnational ICT corporations, and a leading international financial institution in senior roles. He holds an LL.B from SM Law College, Karachi, a Master's in Management from ANU, Australia, and a Master's in Chemistry. Nasr takes a keen interest in governance and ICT policy linkages, enjoys strong collaborative networks, and contributes time to voluntary service. (Note: Nasr is currently on leave from the firm.)

name: Sikander Ali
title: Associate – Tax & Litigation
bio: Sikander Ali has seven years of experience covering corporate taxation along with civil and criminal litigation. He regularly appears before the FBR, Commissioner Appeals, Appellate Tribunal, and various High Courts on complex mandates.
fullBio: Sikander Ali combines tax advisory depth with courtroom advocacy. Over seven years he has represented individuals and corporations before the Federal Board of Revenue, Commissioner Appeals, the Appellate Tribunal, and High Courts nationwide. At DeJure he drives the resolution of intricate direct- and indirect-tax controversies, structures tax planning strategies for both individuals and corporates, and emphasizes compliance and financial efficiency so clients receive pragmatic legal as well as advisory support.

name: Asim Bin Majeed
title: Advocate High Court
bio: Asim Bin Majeed joined DeJure in 2020 after graduating from Pakistan College of Law and has built five years of experience in tax and civil litigation.
fullBio: Asim Bin Majeed is an Advocate of the High Court and has been part of DeJure since 2020. A graduate of Pakistan College of Law, he focuses on tax and civil matters and has developed the prudence required to litigate before Civil Courts, Tribunals, and High Courts. His practice spans advisory and contentious assignments, and he is known for thorough preparation and balanced courtroom temperament.

name: Abdul Wakeel
title: Advocate High Court
bio: Abdul Wakeel practices civil, criminal, and tax law at the Rawalpindi Bench and Civil Courts, supporting the firm's senior partners on high-stakes files.
fullBio: Advocate Abdul Wakeel appears before the Rawalpindi High Court Bench and Civil Courts in civil, criminal, and tax disputes. He holds an LL.M. from the University of Management and Technology (UMT), Lahore, and has been part of DeJure since 2020. Abdul frequently assists the senior partner in High Court litigation at Rawalpindi Bench and is valued for his grasp of complex procedural issues.

name: Arshia Shoaib
title: Associate – Corporate & Tax
bio: Arshia Shoaib joined DeJure in 2023 after completing her LL.B (Hons) from the University of London and contributes to constitutional, corporate, tax, and IP mandates.
fullBio: Arshia Shoaib holds an LL.B (Hons) from the University of London and has assisted prominent lawyers on constitutional, corporate, tax, and intellectual property matters since 2022. She became part of DeJure in February 2023 and also serves on the FPCCI Legal Affairs Committee. Arshia's key interest areas include constitutional, taxation, corporate, and international law, and she is known for her research rigor and polished client briefs.

name: Muhammad Fatehyab Kamran
title: Barrister-at-Law
bio: Barrister M. Fatehyab Kamran completed his LL.B (Hons) from the University of London and was called to the Bar at Lincoln's Inn before joining DeJure in November 2024.
fullBio: Muhammad Fatehyab Kamran (Barrister-at-Law, Lincoln's Inn) holds an LL.B (Hons) from the University of London. He joined DeJure in November 2024 and assists the senior partner on constitutional and taxation mandates. He is also a member of the FPCCI Legal Affairs Committee and brings a strong comparative-law lens to his research and drafting assignments.

name: Mubeen Ali Husnain Awan
title: Advocate High Court
bio: Mubeen Ali Husnain Awan has practiced since 2014 across civil, tax, contracts, and family law, assisting the senior partner at Islamabad High Court.
fullBio: Mubeen Ali Husnain Awan (also known as Mubeen Ali Husnain) is an Advocate of the High Court with an LL.B (Hons) from the International Islamic University, Islamabad. Since beginning practice in 2014 he has appeared in civil, tax, contract, and family law forums, and he assists the senior partner at the Islamabad High Court. He joined DeJure in 2023 and is recognized for his calm litigation style and client-focused communication.
